metadata.Name: Humanity's Last Exam
metadata.Description: A multi-modal benchmark consisting of 2,500 extremely challenging questions across over a hundred subjects, designed to test the capabilities of large language models at the frontier of human knowledge.
metadata.Paper Title: Humanity's Last Exam: A Multi-Modal Benchmark at the Frontier of Human Knowledge
metadata.Venue Title: Humanity's Last Exam: A Multi-Modal Benchmark at the Frontier of Human Knowledge
metadata.Abstract: Benchmarks are important tools for tracking the rapid advancements in large language model (LLM) capabilities. However, benchmarks are not keeping pace in difficulty: LLMs now achieve over 90% accuracy on popular benchmarks like MMLU, limiting informed measurement of state-of-the-art LLM capabilities. In response, we introduce HUMANITY'S LAST EXAM (HLE), a multi-modal benchmark at the frontier of human knowledge, designed to be the final closed-ended academic benchmark of its kind with broad subject coverage. HLE consists of 2,500 questions across dozens of subjects, including mathematics, humanities, and the natural sciences. HLE is developed globally by subject-matter experts and consists of multiple-choice and short-answer questions suitable for automated grading. Each question has a known solution that is unambiguous and easily verifiable, but cannot be quickly answered via internet retrieval.
